body: this is a random failure. though not really sure why it is actually failing

actually first started failing here: https://ci.appveyor.com/project/jreback/pandas-465/build/1.0.186/job/0gea3ih7tcsjddeq

I think this is numpy 1.10.4 / mkl change

so this is a precision difference I think between what ``numexpr`` and ``numpy`` give.
``````

So `numexpr` is returning the very next floating point number after what `numpy` returns.
But 81e3303 introduced something else and build fails after 2 min.

ok skipping that part of the test: https://github.com/pydata/pandas/commit/0c09bd16e1ca1c7af021c5338ee4d85240a6e133

if you want to investigate feel free.

The builds are failing not because of the recipe but because of not enough clone depth. On travis I fixed this. Trying a fix on appveyor.
This will fix the appveyor builds: https://github.com/pydata/pandas/commit/da523e00a8957389a78e9175d73f478dceecf2cf
